fields.description:
As a user of the console I would like an interface to deregister an image so that I don't need to use command-line tools to remove an image from my cloud.

The de-registration could be accomplished via the gear icon drop-down menu item at the Images landing page and/or the Actions menu on the image detail page.

Notes for QA: the following cases will need verificationâ€¦
- The images landing page should display a "Remove from cloud" drop-down menu item when the image owner is the currently logged in account
- The images detail page should display a "Remove from cloud" drop-down menu item when the image owner is the currently logged in account
- We should only display the "delete snapshot" field for EBS images in the "Remove from cloud" dialog
- When an image's snapshot has other images registered in the cloud, we should disable the "delete snapshot" field (leaving it unchecked) in the "Remove from cloud" dialog (and display a notice why the field is disabled)
- When an image is de-registered, we should return the user to the Images landing page.
fields.summary: Allow images to be deregistered via the console

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body: [~dkavanagh]: How would I obtain the account id (the 12-digit identifier for a given account) for the currently signed in user?  I need to show the "Remove from cloud" menu item for images only if the image.owner_id matches the account id of the current account.  I understand we don't currently store the logged-in account id in the console session, but I'm hoping we can shove that into the session via an API call at login.
Assuming you have permission to use iam:GetUser, you can use IAMConnection.get_user with no arguments and grab the account number out of the ARN.
prior to IAM, we would simply look at the owner of the default security group, so if you happen to have either one of those things already in memory, leverage that.

Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/792

[~dkavanagh]: Feel free to assign this to [~jloza] for UX review after your code review.
[~gholms]: Thanks for pointing out iam_conn.get_user(), which worked like a charm!

[~jloza], per my comment in the PR
"What happens when there are multiple images registered to the single snapshot? I'm not sure the delete would succeed in that case. Please confirm that we can actually delete the snapshot in that case. It might require an up-front check and different message to the user if this operation cannot be done."

and from IRC: "we may not want to offer the "also delete the snapshot" option in that case, but might want let them know why"

Thoughts? Wireframe update?

[~dkavanagh] and [~kgill], if the snap is registered to multiple images, the also delete checkbox should be disabled. The wireframe is updated. 

[~scottb] and/or [~tvo], we would need to cover why that is in the guides (there's no inline help for this operation).
kicking back to dev to have checkbox disabled when necessary.
What will you do when the snapshot is owned by a different account?

good point, and I'll add more details for [~kgill]. A snapshot can be shared between accounts. AWS supports this, but Euca does not (currently). So, when managing AWS images, it is certainly possible to have a snapshot for an image that is owned by another user.
We should disable the checkbox in that case as well. Thanks [~gholms]!

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: Would it be acceptable to only display the delete snapshot option on Eucalyptus (to address the image/snapshot ownership issue)?  Pulling the information from the API calls on AWS, especially when the image set is large, adds a significant amount of overhead to an already expensive data fetch.

What filter are you using? By specifying the block-device-mapping.snapshot-id filter for DescribeImages, you can tell if the snapshot is registered for other images and the result should be a small number of images (as few as 1).
We should find a way to support this, our hybrid console tries to support everything on AWS that it does on Euca, unless it is a euca-specific extension.

[~dkavanagh]: Yep, the bdm.snapshot-id filter for DescribeImages works well for the image detail page.  The problem on the landing page, however, is that when a fetch for DescribeImages is performed for each image, the page's load time increases by an order of magnitude.  I'm investigating more efficient ways to fetch that data or perhaps lazy-load it (e.g. when the "remove from cloud" dialog is opened).

I assumed you'd lazy load that. Yes, it would be expensive to do that all the time for a feature people don't use often.
For an example, see how I did lazy-loading of images when "delete snapshot" is requested.

[~jloza], [~dkavanagh], [~gholms]: Unfortunately there isn't an efficient way to perform the snapshot/image owner check on the images landing page AFAICT.  The image BDM only includes the snapshot id and not the snapshot owner, so extra API calls are required to compare the image snapshot ownership.  Meaning we'll need to fetch the snapshot for each image, which will slow the images landing page to a crawl.  

We can perform the check on the image detail page without killing performance, but that would make the UX inconsistent with the landing page.  I suggest we defer that part of this ticket to a later release (if we implement it at all), especially since it only affects the AWS side of our console.
It sounds like you didn't go the lazy-loading route?

Lazy loading would be nice if that will work. Or possibly check only those items that are currently in view? Or when the action button is clicked, before you display the dialog for that particular image?
Agreed. If we only look up the info when the deregister dialog is requested, it's an AJAX call for a single image only.

[~dkavanagh] I'm using the lazy-loading approach when the dialog is opened to get the image, but to do the snapshot ownership comparison, we'll need to do an additional XHR fetch for the snapshot as well.  Having multiple XHR calls could lead to race conditions, unless they're performed serially (which would hamper performance).

Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/792 updated with the images registered from snapshot check.  I've opted not to implement the snapshot ownership check due to potential race conditions, QA testing burden, and difficulties testing on AWS.  We can revisit that part in a future release.
This text in the dialog is misleading "The image itself will not be deleted and can be re-registered later." if the user selects "Delete associated snapshot"

[~jloza]: Just a heads up that we couldn't implement the help icon for the "delete snapshot" field when a snapshot is registered as multiple images since Foundation tooltips don't work when the condition to display the help icon is based on an Ajax fetch (via AngularJS) in a modal dialog.
Verified: eucaconsole-4.0.1-0.0.491.20140630gitcdb7f6f6.el6.noarch
